Project #4

Summary

You are given two jugs with capacities x and y litres. There is an infinite amount of water supply available. You need to determine whether it is possible to measure exactly z litres using these two jugs. If z liters of water is measurable, you must have z liters of water contained within one or both buckets by the end.

Solution

To find the solution to this problem I implemented the A * search algorithm in java in order to find the shortest path which had the lowest cost associated with it.

The A* search algorithm is used to find the shortest path between two nodes in a graph. It works by maintaining a priority queue of nodes to explore, where each node is assigned a score based on the sum of the cost of getting from the starting node to the current node and an estimate of the cost of getting from the current node to the goal node. The algorithm explores nodes in order of their scores until the goal node is reached or the queue is empty. If the goal node is reached, the algorithm returns the path used to reach it. A* is efficient and effective when there is a lot of heuristic information available.

Using this method allowed me not only to find the defined problem, but to also let the user create their own constraints on the volume / capacity of the current and desired jugs.
